intro: Harpalyce ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty harpalyce, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods are hairy and contain several small, round seeds. Harpalyce ferruginea is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
